sec.title: Question
sec.p: What are contemporary trends in the characteristics and outcomes of patients with newly diagnosed cirrhosis?

sec.title: Findings
sec.p: In this cohort study of 9261 patients with newly diagnosed cirrhosis from 2004 to 2014, the proportions of patients younger than 40 years and those 65 years and older increased significantly, as did the proportions with alcoholic cirrhosis and nonalcoholic steatohepatitis. Mortality decreased over time.

sec.title: Meaning
sec.p: The population of patients with newly diagnosed cirrhosis is facing changes in demographic characteristics, clinical features, and outcomes that may affect future care.
